stimulusHtml: Use a trapezoidal sum with the four subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate the area of the cross section of the river at Picnic Point, in square feet. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

features.html:
Distance from the river's edge (feet)

 0 8 14 22 24
Depth of the water (feet) 0 7 8 2 0

A scientist measures the depth of the Doe River at Picnic Point. The river is 24 feet wide at this location. The measurements are taken in a straight line perpendicular to the edge of the river. The data are shown in the table above. The velocity of the water at Picnic Point, in feet per minute, is modeled by  v( t )=16+2sin( t+10 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45E3@ for 0 ≤ t ≤ 120 minutes.
